fast3d.complex.light

Class PointLight

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.complex.light.ObstructableLight
      • fast3d.complex.light.PointLight
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Light

    public class PointLight
extends ObstructableLight
    a point light works like the light out of some street light
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Color lightColor
      the color of the light
      Vector3d pos
      the position of this light-source in the universe

        calculateShadows

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PointLight(Universe uni, Color c, Vector3d pos)
      because this sort of light is located, it may be obstructed and cause shadow behind a Renderable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector3d directionOfLight(Illuminatable r)
      for every Illuminatable in space, this will be different because of it's relative position to this light-source
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      compares this with the parameter and returns false if the parameter is not of the same type
      Vector3d getPos()
      to calculate all Renderables between the currently to illuminate Illuminatable and the light source using ray tracing it it necessary to create a ray out if the lights position to not consider renderables behind the light (from the currently to illuminate Illuminatable) as being in front of the light
      Color illuminate(Illuminatable c)
      calculates the visible color for the given illuminatable;
      the visible color is the color of the pixels on the screen for the given renderable
      java.lang.String toString()

        getUniverse, obstructings

    • Constructor Detail

      • PointLight

        public PointLight(Universe uni,
                  Color c,
                  Vector3d pos)
        because this sort of light is located, it may be obstructed and cause shadow behind a Renderable
        Parameters:
        uni - the universe to contain all shadow-causing Renderables
        c - the light-color
        pos - the position of this light-source in the universe

    • Method Detail

      • illuminate

        public Color illuminate(Illuminatable c)
        Description copied from interface: Light
        calculates the visible color for the given illuminatable;
        the visible color is the color of the pixels on the screen for the given renderable
        Specified by:
        illuminate in interface Light
        Specified by:
        illuminate in class ObstructableLight
        Parameters:
        c - the illuminatable giving the data of its surface
        Returns:
        the visible color to draw the illuminatable in if no other light is used

      • getPos

        public Vector3d getPos()
        Description copied from class: ObstructableLight
        to calculate all Renderables between the currently to illuminate Illuminatable and the light source using ray tracing it it necessary to create a ray out if the lights position to not consider renderables behind the light (from the currently to illuminate Illuminatable) as being in front of the light
        Specified by:
        getPos in class ObstructableLight
        Returns:
        a reference

      • directionOfLight

        public Vector3d directionOfLight(Illuminatable r)
        for every Illuminatable in space, this will be different because of it's relative position to this light-source
        Specified by:
        directionOfLight in class ObstructableLight
        Parameters:
        r - the Illuminatable to calculate the relative position to
        Returns:
        the direction of this light to the given Renderable
